info.name: LamariFit API
info.description: Complete API collection for LamariFit - A comprehensive fitness tracking API with authentication, workout planning, exercise management, and social features (Updated with workouts, enrollments, and workout plan items endpoints)

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Register a new user account

Register a new user account with trainer profile. The trainer_profile field is optional. All trainer profile fields are optional (bio, specialty_ids, hourly_rate, location). Visibility defaults to 'private' if not specified. Visibility options: public (searchable), link_only (viewable with link), private (owner/admin only).
Login with email and password
Get current user profile (requires authentication)
Exchange a refresh token for a new access/refresh token pair. The old refresh token is revoked (token rotation).
Revoke the current session's refresh token
Revoke all refresh tokens for the authenticated user (logout from all devices)

header.description: Optional: Include to mark current session

request.description: Get all active sessions for the authenticated user
Revoke a specific session by its ID

item.description: Standard email/password authentication endpoints with refresh token support. Access tokens expire in 1 hour, refresh tokens expire in 7 days.

item.name: Workouts

request.description: Create a new standalone workout for the authenticated user

query.description: Filter by muscle group ID (can repeat for multiple)
Filter by exercise ID (can repeat for multiple)
Filter mode: 'or' (default) matches ANY filter, 'and' matches ALL filters
Filter to only show favorited workouts

request.description:
Get all workouts for the authenticated user with pagination and filtering.

**Filter Parameters:**
- `search`: Search workouts by title (case-insensitive)
- `muscle_group_id`: Filter by muscle group(s) - repeat parameter for multiple IDs
- `exercise_id`: Filter by exercise(s) - repeat parameter for multiple IDs
- `mode`: Filter logic - 'or' (default) matches ANY filter, 'and' matches ALL filters
- `is_favorited`: Filter to only show favorited workouts

**Examples:**
- Single muscle group: `?muscle_group_id=uuid1`
- Multiple muscle groups (OR): `?muscle_group_id=uuid1&muscle_group_id=uuid2`
- Multiple muscle groups (AND): `?muscle_group_id=uuid1&muscle_group_id=uuid2&mode=and`
- Combined filters: `?muscle_group_id=uuid1&exercise_id=uuid2&mode=or`

query.description: OR mode: returns workouts with ANY of the muscle groups

request.description: Example: Get workouts containing exercises that target ANY of the specified muscle groups (OR logic)

query.description: AND mode: returns workouts with ALL of the muscle groups

request.description: Example: Get workouts containing exercises that target ALL of the specified muscle groups (AND logic)

item.description: Email-based invitations for trainers to invite potential clients who may not have accounts yet. Invitations are converted to trainer-client links when the invitee registers.

Session set endpoints for logging individual sets within a session exercise.

## Weight Handling
All weights are stored in kilograms (kg) as the canonical unit.

### Request Fields
- `actual_reps`: Number of reps performed
- `actual_weight (with weight_value and weight_unit)`: Weight value (will be converted if weight_unit is 'lb')
- `weight_unit`: Optional - 'kg' or 'lb'. If 'lb', the weight is converted to kg.
- `actual_duration_seconds`: For timed/isometric exercises
- `rpe_value_id`: Reference to RPE scale value
- `was_failure`: Whether the set was taken to failure

### Response Fields
- `actual_weight (with weight_value and weight_unit)`: Weight in kilograms
- `actual_weight_display`: Converted weight for display
- `actual_weight_unit`: Display unit ('kg' or 'lb')

item.description:
Location-based search endpoints for finding users and trainers.

## Search Strategies (Priority Order)
1. **Radius Search**: When lat/lng provided, searches within specified radius using Haversine formula
2. **Structured Search**: When country_code, region, city, district, or postal_code provided
3. **Free-text Search**: When 'q' parameter provided, searches across all location text fields
4. **No Filter**: When no location params provided, returns all public results

## Location Response Format
```json
{
  "location": {
    "latitude": 40.7128,
    "longitude": -74.0060,
    "country_code": "US",
    "region": "NY",
    "city": "New York",
    "district": "Manhattan",
    "postal_code": "10001",
    "raw_address": "123 Main St, New York, NY"
  },
  "distance_km": 5.2
}
```

The `distance_km` field is only included when using radius search.
